ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: Simi Bhat

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: 10. This was a great crash course in law for environmental folk. I had no experience with admin law and now I feel like I understand how the system works.
Excellent professor. Good survey of environmental law.
The class was enjoyable and a learning experience.
The last two classes.
Professor Elliot.
Professor Elliott provides a lot of relevant anecdotes about his personal experiences that keep the class interesting.
Elliott's expansive knowledge of environmental law, lawmaking, and policymaking (as former general counsel of EPA), as well as his perspective as a current practitioner.
The lectures are very good and though-provoking.
Extremely well qualified instructor, engaging and interesting lectures, bright and informed fellow students, and excellent text book.
The professor is very engaging and has been directly involved with many of the statutes. He also comes at it from a very moderate point of view.
An opportunity to receive direct input and critique from two very knowlegable legal professors.
Discussion in class and in the readings of how different developments in environmental law connect.

The text book was excellent and I learned a great deal about a few large environmental laws and also about environmental regulations generally. Professor Elliott is well prepared, well spoken, and very knowledgeable. I would recommend this course to any FES student.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Elliott tried to get two classes per week instead of one three-hour block. This certainly would have been preferable.
The in class exercises could have been better structured.
Stream-of-consciousness lecture style can sometimes be difficult to follow.

I felt that we often spent too much time going over the particulars of environmental statutes. Perhaps that was valuable for the law students but I was hoping to cover more topics and discuss law and regulation more generally. Instead we were often mired in the particulars of a given law, some of which were irrelevant to me.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Both Professors Kennedy and Esty were very know accessible, and I'd estimate I traded email with them at least a dozen times during the semester. TA Simi Bhat was also available and answered email questions alost immediately.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: The law that underpins the political environmental framework is not something an FES student must learn, according the curriculum, but it is something every FES student certainly should learn. This class, by working through the major environmental statutes of the seventies, offers perspective on how the legislative, judicial, and administrative machinery thinks about environmental issues and enacts environmental remedies.
Being interested in law, this course was a no-brainer and absolutely vital to my program of study.
The legal content complements my environmental interests, and my specific research topic was on point with my overal program.

This was my first exposure to law and regulations and I have found it useful for every other class I have taken. I plan to work in environmental policy and as such found this course invaluable for understanding how environmental laws work and are made.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Just interested. Seems like a good subject to know something about.
General interest
Interest and bin.
Interested in law and policy.
To have to opportunity to get deeply involved in a issue that has the potential to change the status quo for the better.
I wanted a better overarching understanding of U.S. environmental law.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes.
Yes.
Yes, small class with great professor.
Yes. Having the class held at the Law School and being in a class with YLS students was especially exciting.
I really enjoyed the class and the course content, so yes.
Yes, very much so. Three hour classes were a bit rough some days but it was nice to only have to travel to the law school once a week.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes, and then some. Great course.
Yes.
Yes.
Yes, although my topic was more policy than legal.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: There were advantages in bouncing ideas off others, having them assit on my sections, and me reviewing their parts. The hardest part is coordinating our work schedules. Also, our group paper did not go in the exact direction that it would have if I was doing it alone. It was more polished and comprehensive, but the content of the paper was not in my total control.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Do the readings--lots to learn.
Keep up with the readings. Ask questions.
Get an outline from somebody who has already taken the class, and use this to inform the reading as you do it. There is much to read, and focusing attention would be helpful.

B/c the final is the only grade, it's very easy to fall behind in reading. Thisis dangerous b/c there is an enormous amount of it, and it's hardly possible to simply put it off until the week before the final.

Start you paper early, and push your client for information. Although they are the ones that you are working for, the final paper has the students name on it and it it how you are graded, so take control and don't let your path be totally dictated.
Be prepared for a LOT of reading - but it's a really interesting class and well worth taking.
